content.description:
A variation on the first pitch of Piggly Wiggly. Follow that through the thin start and thin handcrack corner until a traverse left along a foot shelf with crimps above accesses the hanging splitter to the left of the major dihedral proper. Handcrack through some OW moves lead past the right side of the "coffin" flake (we wailed on it with the prybar and it doesn't move) and into the crux bulge on ringlocks and thin handjams. Finish up an easier wide slot to the major ledge. A great crack pitch on pretty fine Schnebly with a good dose of variety jamming. 

 Summit via the 2nd pitch of Piggly Wiggly and rap off accordingly.
content.location: Starts the same as Piggly Wiggly up the major dihedral on the north side of the spire. Cut left to the hanging splitter partway up the first pitch.

content.description:
The major open book feature on the north side has a tight-hands to steep OW crack up it.

 P1--Some thin moves and stemming off the ground lead to thin-hand jamming between pods with a slight right lean. A chimney pod with chockstones leads to a crux overhanging, left-leaning fistcrack with decent face features and a step left at the top. Belay off of anchors on a large ledge. The rock is pretty good Schnebly, although slightly crunchy still until it sees more traffic. A good, physical crack pitch. (5.10, 75')

 P2--Walk right from the anchors and bust an awkward boulder problem over a silty, ringlock bulge to easier crack rambling. Delicately move up the crack past blocky ledges. The anchor is 10' below the summit for rock quality; summit carefully on loose, easy terrain. This potentially could be linked with P1, but drag may be an issue. (5.9, 25')

 Rap or lower from top anchor to ledge and rap back to base from there. (1X) 60m rope will do.
content.location: The very obvious major dihedral on the north side of the spire.

content.description: This squat lump sits uphill from Scorpion Spire and on the approach to Centipede Spire. It won't win any beauty contests for tower-like aesthetics, but it does offer a couple of worthwhile routes.
